due ability maintain secure attachment mussels tethered substratum byssus composed numerous extracellular collagenous threads secreted foot each byssal thread three serially arranged parts corrugated proximal region smooth distal region adhesive plaque this study examines material structural properties byssal threads three mussel species mytilus californianus m. trossulus m. galloprovincialis flows around wings however recent developments high-speed videography tools computational mechanical modeling allowed researchers make rapid progress advancing understanding insect flight these mechanical computational fluid dynamic models combined modern flow visualization techniques revealed fluid dynamic phenomena underlying flapping flight different non-flapping 2-d wings previous models based in particular even high angles attack prominent leading edge vortex remains stably attached insect wing shed unsteady wake would expected non-flapping 2-d wings its presence greatly enhances forces generated wing thus enabling insects hover maneuver in addition flight forces enhanced mechanisms acting changes angle attack especially stroke reversal mutual interaction two wings dorsal stroke reversal wing-wake interactions following stroke reversal this progress enabled development simple analytical empirical models allow us calculate instantaneous forces flapping insect wings accurately previously possible it also promises foster new exciting multi-disciplinary collaborations physicists seek explain phenomenology biologists seek understand relevance insect physiology evolution engineers inspired build micro-robotic insects using principles this review covers basic physical principles underlying flapping flight insects results recent experiments concerning aerodynamics insect flight well different approaches used model phenomena

aquaporins aqps represent ubiquitous class integral membrane proteins play critical roles cellular osmoregulations microbes plants mammals aqps primarily function water-conducting channels whereas members sub-class aqps termed aquaglyceroporins permeable small neutral solutes glycerol while aqps facilitate transmembrane permeation water and/or small neutral solutes preclude conduction protons turtle pseudemys concinna individuals living lotic environments flatter streamlined shells living lentic environments however flatter shape may also make shells less capable resisting predator-induced sponge monorhaphis chuni represents longest natural siliceous structure earth this spicule composed concentrically arranged lamellae approximately 10 ╬╝m thick in present study investigated formation outer lamellae cellular level using microscopic spectroscopic techniques it shown formation outermost lamella begins association cell clusters surface thickening and/or growing spicule the cells release silica controlled formation lamella the pericellular silica material fuses delimited textured layer silica depressions approximately 20тау30 ╬╝m diameter the newly formed layer initially displays 40 ╬╝m wide well-structured banded ribbons attains plain surface final step the chemical composition depressions studied using energy dispersive x-ray spectroscopy staining texas red the data suggest depressions nests silica-forming cells silica formation starts direct association silica-forming cells outer surface spicule remain initiate development next lamellae

REFP_164-433-532-959-150 REFP_177-407-643-140-001 REFP_178-041-773-262-376 REFP_178-425-711-195-756 an overview plant cuticle biomechanics plant biomechanics combines principles physics chemistry engineering answer questions plant growth development interaction environment the epidermal-growth-control theory postulated 1867 verified 2007 states epidermal cells determine rate organ elongation since tension inner tissues compression the lipid cuticle layer deposited surface outer epidermal cell walls modifies chemical mechanical nature cell walls thus plant cuticle plays key role plant interaction environment controlling organ expansion rheological analyses indicate cuticle mostly viscoelastic strain-hardening material stiffens comparatively elastic epidermal cell walls cuticle stiffness attributed polysaccharides flavonoids present cuticle whereas cutin matrix mainly responsible extensibility environmental conditions temperature relative humidity plasticizing effect mechanical properties cuticle since lower cuticle stiffness strength the external appearance agricultural commodities especially fruits great economic value mechanical properties cuticle positive negative effect disorders like fruit cracking fungal pathogen penetration pest infestation cuticle rheology significant variability within species thus subjected selection order breed cultivars resistant pests infestation disorders
